intro.title: Introduction
intro.p1: KopTup - Tech Solutions ("we", "our" or "the company") is committed to protecting the privacy of our clients and users. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, share and protect personal information when you use our software development, technology consulting and digital solutions services.
intro.p2: By using our services, you agree to the practices described in this policy. If you do not agree with this policy, please do not use our services.

c1.subtitle: 1.1 Personal Information
c1.text: We collect information you provide directly to us, including: name, email address, phone number, company, billing information and any other information you choose to share with us when using our services.

c2.subtitle: 1.2 Usage Information
c2.text: We automatically collect information about your interaction with our services, including: IP address, browser type, pages visited, time spent, cookies and web analytics data.

c3.subtitle: 1.3 Project Information
c3.text: When you hire our services, we collect information related to the project: technical requirements, documentation, shared files and communications related to development.

c1.subtitle: 2.1 Service Delivery
c1.text: We use your information to provide, maintain and improve our software development, technology consulting and digital solutions services.

c2.subtitle: 2.2 Communication
c2.text: To communicate with you about your projects, service updates, technical support and to answer your queries.

c3.subtitle: 2.3 Service Improvement
c3.text: We analyze the use of our services to improve user experience, develop new features and optimize our processes.

c4.subtitle: 2.4 Marketing
c4.text: With your consent, we may send you information about new services, updates and special offers. You may unsubscribe at any time.

c1.subtitle: 3.1 Security Measures
c1.text: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure or destruction. This includes SSL/TLS encryption, firewalls, access controls and regular security audits.

c2.subtitle: 3.2 Limited Access
c2.text: Access to your personal information is limited to employees, contractors and agents who need to know this information to process it on our behalf and are subject to confidentiality obligations.

c3.subtitle: 3.3 Storage
c3.text: Your data is stored on secure servers located in certified data centers. We use trusted cloud service providers like AWS that comply with international security standards.

c1.subtitle: 4.1 Service Providers
c1.text: We share information with external service providers who help us operate our business (hosting, analytics, payment processing), who are obligated to protect your information.

c2.subtitle: 4.2 Legal Requirements
c2.text: We may disclose your information if required by law, a court order, or to protect our rights, property or safety.

c3.subtitle: 4.3 Business Transfers
c3.text: In the event of a merger, acquisition or sale of assets, your personal information may be transferred. We will notify you before your information is transferred and becomes subject to a different privacy policy.

c4.subtitle: 4.4 No Data Sale
c4.text: KopTup does NOT sell, rent or commercialize your personal information to third parties for advertising purposes.

c1.subtitle: 5.1 Retention Period
c1.text: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes set out in this policy, unless the law requires or permits a longer retention period.

c2.subtitle: 5.2 Project Data
c2.text: Data related to projects is retained for the duration of the project and an additional period for support and warranty purposes, typically 1-3 years after completion.

c3.subtitle: 5.3 Deletion
c3.text: When we no longer need your information, we will securely delete it or anonymize it so that you cannot be identified.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.subtitle: You have the right to control your personal information. Below are your rights:

r1.title: Access
r1.description: Request a copy of the personal information we hold about you.

r2.title: Rectification
r2.description: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information.

r3.title: Deletion
r3.description: Request deletion of your personal information under certain circumstances.

r4.title: Portability
r4.description: Receive your information in a structured and commonly used format.

r5.title: Objection
r5.description: Object to the processing of your information for certain purposes.

r6.title: Restriction
r6.description: Request that we restrict the processing of your information.

rights.exerciseText: To exercise any of these rights, contact us through:
rights.responseTime: We will respond to your request within 30 business days.

s6.title: 6. Cookies and Similar Technologies
s6.p1: We use cookies and similar technologies to improve your experience, analyze the use of our services and personalize content. Cookies are small text files stored on your device.
s6.p2: You can control the use of cookies through your browser settings. However, please note that disabling cookies may affect the functionality of our services.

s7.title: 7. International Transfers
s7.p1: Your information may be transferred and stored on servers located outside Colombia. We take measures to ensure your information receives an adequate level of protection wherever it is processed.
s7.p2: By using our services, you consent to these international transfers of your information.

s8.title: 8. Children's Privacy
s8.p1: Our services are not directed at individuals under 18 years of age. We do not intentionally collect personal information from minors. If we discover we have collected information from a minor without appropriate parental consent, we will delete that information immediately.

s9.title: 9. Changes to this Policy
s9.p1: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal or regulatory reasons. The "Last updated" date at the top indicates when the policy was last reviewed.
s9.p2: We will notify you of material changes by posting the new policy on our website and, where appropriate, by email. We recommend reviewing this policy periodically.

s10.title: 10. Contact
s10.text: If you have questions, concerns or requests related to this Privacy Policy or our data handling practices, contact us:

c1.subtitle: 2.1 Service Description
c1.text: KopTup offers professional software development and technology solutions services, including but not limited to: web and mobile application development, artificial intelligence systems, chatbots, e-commerce platforms, API integrations, technology consulting, UX/UI design and maintenance services.

c2.subtitle: 2.2 Project Scope
c2.text: The specific scope of each project will be defined in a separate commercial proposal or contract. Each project will include: specific objectives, deliverables, timeline, budget and payment conditions.

c3.subtitle: 2.3 Scope Changes

c1.subtitle: 3.1 Pricing
c1.text: Service prices will be specified in the corresponding commercial proposal. All prices are expressed in Colombian pesos (COP) or US dollars (USD), as agreed, and do not include applicable taxes unless otherwise specified.

c2.subtitle: 3.2 Payment Terms
c2.text: We generally require a 50% advance at project start and the remaining 50% upon completion. For larger projects, we may establish specific payment milestones. Payments must be made within 15 days of invoice issuance.

c3.subtitle: 3.3 Late Payments
c3.text: Payments not made by the due date will be subject to a late interest charge of 1.5% per month. KopTup reserves the right to suspend services until payment is regularized.

c4.subtitle: 3.4 Additional Expenses

c3.subtitle: 4.3 Third-Party Licenses

c4.subtitle: 4.4 Portfolio and Marketing

c1.subtitle: 5.1 Confidential Information
c1.text: Both parties agree to keep confidential all proprietary, commercial or technical information shared during the business relationship. This includes but is not limited to: source code, designs, business strategies, client data and financial information.

c2.subtitle: 5.2 Exceptions
c2.text: The confidentiality obligation does not apply to information that: is in the public domain, is independently developed, is required by law, or is authorized in writing for disclosure.

c3.subtitle: 5.3 Duration
c3.text: Confidentiality obligations will remain in force during the business relationship and for a period of 3 years after its termination.

c1.subtitle: 6.1 Timeline
c1.text: Delivery deadlines will be specified in the project proposal and are considered estimates based on the agreed scope. We will make our best effort to meet established deadlines.

c2.subtitle: 6.2 Delays
c2.text: Deadlines may be extended due to: scope changes requested by the client, delays in providing necessary information or materials, force majeure circumstances, or unforeseen technical issues.

c3.subtitle: 6.3 Client Collaboration

c1.subtitle: 7.1 Service Warranty
c1.text: We guarantee that services will be performed professionally and in accordance with industry standards. We provide a warranty period of 30-90 days (as agreed) to correct errors or defects in the delivered code.

c2.subtitle: 7.2 Warranty Exclusions
